positions.companyName: U.S Department of Justice, Drug Enforcement Administration
positions.description: I advised and assisted managers in developing and formulating all financial, personnel, and property management issues, oversaw and developed budget estimates,justifications,ensuring that funds are used in accordance with the operating budget and legal requirements and was the primary assistant responsible for the professional management and analysis of various programs including the Priority Target Program, Law Enforcement Personnel, Special Agents, Vacancies and On Board Staffing, Field Management Plan, Effective Leadership, Business Processes for the division, Change Management and Evaluations. I was responsible for writing all speeches for the Special Agent in Charge as well as memos, letters, awards, correspondence.  I collaborated with managers in developing goals, solutions, approaches, and concepts. I advised management and employees on design, development, and implementation of programs under them. I served as program representative in meetings, on panels, on committees, and/or evaluation boards. I developed, analyzed and/or implemented procedures and policies to ensure awareness and compliance with regulations and other requirements.  I also developed written material and make oral presentations, as required write reports of findings, results, or accomplishments for information or action. I discussed problems concerns with team members, manager, and colleagues and exchange ideas and information with internal and external customers, and colleagues, individually and at meetings.  I also assisted with projection and justification of annual budgetary requirements; provide guidance and assistance to the SAC, ASACS and Group Supervisors on operational and/or administrative matters, recruitment, relocation of special agents, analyzee and made recommendations on the effectiveness and efficiency of administrative operations, policies, and procedures as well as prepare policies and divisional orders for the SAC.
positions.title: Program Analyst

positions.companyName: Department of Defense,Defense Logistics Agency, Defense Supply Center Philadelphia
positions.description: I served as the principal advisor to the Chief of the Produce Business Unit providing oral and written communications to her and her section chiefs (GS-15) on program projection plans relating to customer relations management, business processes, operational planning, change management, policy analysis, and program evaluation for a variety of programs including security, contingency, gsa leases, personnel, equipment, leadership training, and various operational, effective leadership, management and administrative functions. I was responsible for the formulation of near-time and long-range divisional operational, budget, financial,  management, and administrative plans and policies that reflect the DoD, DSCP and our offices located throughout the continental United States, Europe and Pacific.  I reviewed and evaluated the effectiveness of the various programs and the most cost-effective use of resources. I was responsible for tracking and scheduling Business Systems Modernization (BSM) Training for the business unit. This involved coordinating with the BSM training office. I provided guidance to the Chief and our office chiefs located throughout the world in the areas of operational and management plans and policies, and resources utilization. In contingency operations such as Operation Desert Storm, Enduring Freedom/Force, I analyzed and reviewed situation reports, call back rosters, command control center monitoring. I developed, implemented, and administered contingency and emergency preparedness planning efforts for the Produce Business Unit to continue essential operations and discharge responsibilities during and following various types of emergency situations such as 9/11, Operation Desert Storm and Operation Iraqi Freedom.  I also developed, implemented, and monitored policies, instructions, procedures, control systems and methods for the Subsistence Directorate.
